title: ‘Okay!’: Helpful employee is scolded by arrogant boss for taking workplace initiative, so they fill up boss's entire afternoon with back-to-back interviews
description: When you grow comfortable in your role at work, you understandably start taking more workplace initiative. You know the ropes, you know your boss, and you hope all of your efforts to do more without being asked to will count toward a generous raise. Many bosses appreciate employee independence and initiative, while others see their subordinates as a threat to their position. Sometimes, subordinates are after their boss's job, but others are simply trying to get a bigger paycheck for doing menial tasks… and there's nothing wrong with that!In this story, an employee and their coworker take on some interviews at an MD's private medical practice. They were asked to do so by their boss, and these interviews were scheduled in a way that aligned with their schedules.Their boss was having a bad day and blamed both of them for things that were not in their control, then proceeded to scold them for changing interview times (despite them doing so because of lateness on the boss's part). As a result, they were asked to stop doing interviews. Well, that's her problem now!
author: Lana DeGaetano
excerpt: ‘Okay!’: Helpful employee is scolded by arrogant boss for taking workplace initiative, so they fill up boss's entire afternoon with back-to-back interviews - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: Wishy-washy bosses who can never keep their temperature warm and only function on hot and cold emotional settings tend to give their employees whiplash. This dynamic is kin to a parent who either treats their kids like golden gods or dirt on the bottom of a shoe depending on their day at work… and that should tell you something about the kind of boss you do not want to work for. The employee in this story is dealing with a hot-headed boss who uses them as a scapegoat. However, in this instance, they messed up. Big time.
